intro: Helicophyllum, commonly known as the spiral-leaved plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Helicophyllum species are known for their aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and medicinal properties.
